executive_summary: Since health retreats are part of the service sector, revenue is primarily influenced by changes in total recreation expenditure, leisure time and the number of domestic trips. COVID-19 made it impossible for health retreats to operate effectively because of pandemic restrictions. At the same time, fears about getting the virus caused demand for spas and the total number of domestic trips to drop significantly. These factors caused revenue to crater in 2020. As the US economy opened up, consumers started using the excess cash they received from COVID-19 subsidies, resulting in higher recreation expenditure, more domestic travel and higher corporate profit, causing downstream demand for health retreats to skyrocket. Recessionary fears have recently hampered revenue growth as concerns about future economic conditions have caused consumers to cut back on fun spending.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments imposed temporary lockdowns and initiated social distancing measures. These provisions made it nearly impossible for health retreats to operate, severely reducing business for the industry. Demand for spas also plunged as households were afraid to catch the virus at health retreats. The number of domestic trips also fell dramatically as people didn't want to get COVID-19 on vacation, which hindered revenue growth. Struggles on the supply and demand sides caused revenue to fall by nearly half in 2020.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue for health retreats in the United States is anticipated to creep upward at a CAGR of 0.1% during the current period, reaching $28.9 billion in 2024. This includes a 0.6% rise in that year. Profit has responded to shifts in revenue growth. When downstream demand plunged during the pandemic recovery, profit declined significantly. As the economy opened up, profit displayed a big jump. Volatility will decline during the outlook period as stable economic conditions will foster revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RECREATION EXPENDITURE SURGED DURING THE PANDEMIC
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the US economy opened up, more individuals used COVID-19 relief funds to splurge on fun activities, causing total recreation expenditure to soar. Some of this increased spending was devoted to spas, which benefited the industry. Concerns about catching the virus also abated, causing families to take more vacations. More households ended up at health retreats, aiding revenue growth. High consumer spending caused corporate profit to soar during the recovery. High corporate profit gave companies the funds to send their employees on health retreats, so demand from businesses also significantly increased during the recovery.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RECESSIONARY FEARS HAVE CAUSED DEMAND FOR THE INDUSTRY'S SERVICES TO SLOW
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: High inflation has caused the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates. The elevated cost of borrowing has threatened to hinder consumption, raising the possibility of a recession in the near future. Households have become more conservative with their spending as they fear bad times may be coming. The rate of growth in recreation expenditure and the number of domestic trips have slowed down as a result, constraining revenue growth. High-interest rates have also made it more expensive for businesses to afford their existing obligations, eating into their profit. Lower corporate profit has caused businesses to fund fewer health retreats, which has also reduced revenue growth recently.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STEADY ECONOMIC GROWTH WILL SPUR DOWNSTREAM DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears currently threaten consumers and businesses, the US economy is expected to perform well during the outlook period. Rising GDP will cause wages to expand, causing per capita disposable income to grow. Consumers will use more of their income to spend on fun activities and take more vacations, increasing demand for the industry's services. Steady economic growth will also cause corporate profit to jump, giving companies more funds to spend on health retreats for their employees. Higher tax revenue will give more funds to government agencies, causing demand from the public sector to also rise.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AN OVERWORKED SOCIETY WILL HINDER SPENDING ON HEALTH RETREATS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While strong economic conditions will cause spending on fun activities to soar, more Americans will work longer hours to ensure their incomes grow rapidly. As more time is eaten up by work, the time spent on leisure and sports will remain stagnant despite higher spending on recreational activities. Since households will need to make more difficult decisions about what recreational activities to engage in because of time constraints, some individuals will forego going on health retreats, hindering revenue growth somewhat.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry operate health spas with accommodations. These include health resorts and spas that provide lodging. Players offer multi-day, single-day, destination, medical and other accommodations to households and individuals, businesses and governmental bodies.

key_trends: Spending on health retreats has been incredibly volatile during the current period. The pandemic caused revenue to plunge while soaring recreation expenditure during the recovery resulted in record-high demand for the industry's services.
Steady economic growth during the outlook period will increase per capita disposable income and corporate profit. These factors will boost downstream demand for health retreats in the United States.

Since health retreats are accommodations, they're subject to various regulations. These include licensing and permits, health and safety standards, staff qualifications, environmental regulations, accessibility rules and smoking bans.

The industry receives some private and public assistance. One private organization that aids health retreats is the International SPA Association (ISPA), which provides resources, research and networking opportunities for professionals.

Multi-day spa accommodations comprise the largest share of revenue because the industry's primary function is to provide long-term retreats. Single-day spas are also popular because they're accessible and affordable.

Households comprise the largest share of revenue because individuals partake in health retreats. High-income families can afford to go on health retreats the most, so they're very prominent in determining the success of this industry.
Market share concentration is low because of localization and modest barriers to entry. Revenue growth during the outlook period will encourage more entry into the industry, reducing consolidation.

Barriers to entry are fairly hefty because of licensing and hefty start-up costs. Health retreats still don't need to invest in plants and equipment, hindering the costs of initial investments somewhat.

There are many spas, so consumers, businesses and government agencies discriminate based on price, giving them buyer power. Supplier power is fairly low because the companies that sell furniture, food, soap and other products to health retreats aren't concentrated.

External competition is very high since health retreats operate in the service sector. Substitutes include traditional hotels, casinos, campgrounds and RV activities, hostels, boot camps and other outdoor activities.
Profit has ebbed and flowed with the industry's performance. Health retreats became far less profitable during COVID-19, while net income rose during the pandemic recovery.

market_segmentation.segment_description: High-income households alone make up nearly half of revenue, as wealthy families have the funds to go to spas and afford expensive health retreats.
Low-and-middle-income consumers still use the industry's services because day spas are fairly accessible to them.

While individuals exclusively take advantage of the industry's services, businesses make up more than one-tenth of revenue because many companies pay for their employees to go to spas as a form of annual treat.
Government agencies also sometimes sponsor retreats, causing the public sector to make up a non-negligible share of revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Multi-day spas provide accommodations to customers going on a retreat away from work and other normal activities for an extended period of time. These spas are often part of hotels or resorts and cater to guests staying on the property.
Day spas provide a range of services that customers can access over the span of a few hours. These include treatments such as messages, facials, body wraps, manicures and pedicures.

Other spas include mineral springs, ayurvedic and thermal spas. Mineral springs and thermal spas offer treatments using mineral-rich waters for therapeutic purposes, as soaking in hot springs is believed to heal users. Ayurvedic spas are rooted in the ancient Indian practice of Ayurveda and offer therapies used to balance body, mind and spirit using herbal remedies, massages and personalized diet plans.

Individuals, couples and families use destination spas to take a long vacation away from work and other stresses of daily life. These spas are often located in a remote place, where various wellness services are offered, such as healthy meals, fitness activities, educational classes and workshops.
Medical spas combine medical procedures with traditional spa services. They provide treatments such as Botox, laser hair removal, chemical peels and other procedures.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Health retreats rely on economic, social, political and environmental factors that enable consumers to travel domestically on overnight or day trips for leisure purposes. These factors include lower gas prices for automobiles and airlines, as well as heightened consumer and business sentiment. When domestic travel rises, more consumers tend to go to health retreats, boosting revenue for the industry.

Household disposable income, which is affected by changes in interest rates, wages, taxes and employment, can influence demand for health retreats. Since the industry's services are discretionary, lower per capita disposable income typically results in weaker demand. Declines in per capita disposable income pose a potential threat to the industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Time spent on leisure and sports includes socializing and communicating, watching television, surfing the internet, playing games, reading, playing sports, exercising and participating in recreation. Since going to health retreats is a form of leisure, an increase in this driver typically benefits the industry. Growth in time spent on leisure and sports represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: LOW SUPPLIER POWER HINDERS PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Health retreats must contend with high purchase costs to hold an inventory of spa and lifestyle equipment. As virtual reality and digital technology capabilities continue to emerge, many players are also increasingly adopting these systems to assist with their operations. These purchases include smart sleep technology, fitness equipment and artificial intelligence (AI) systems. While high inflation has caused purchase costs to soar, health retreats have been able to negotiate with their suppliers since concentration is low upstream. As a result, purchases' revenue share has held pretty steady during the current period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

volatility_points.volatility_title: RECREATION SPENDING MOVES SPORADICALLY WITH THE US ECONOMY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for health retreats is primarily driven by total recreation expenditure, which rises and falls with economic conditions. COVID-19 made it impossible for most spas to operate effectively, so revenue plunged. Demand for the industry's services soared during the pandemic recovery as rising incomes and fully operating retreats enabled individuals to use spas at record levels. These shifts have caused revenue volatility to be extremely high during the current period.
